page.title: 01HORNCLIFFE.SCHOOL'S DISTRICT
page.content: We are a group of fifteen children from Horncliffe County First School. Our school is in Horncliffe Village and the children come to school from within the area allocated to us which lies in Northumberland County. Our village is situated on the edge of the border between England and Scotland and our block lies astride the border which is the River Tweed. Horncliffe is about five miles up- stream from the mouth of the river where the town of Berwick-upon-Tweed is situated. The River Tweed is famous for its salmon and there are several fisheries close to the village. Most of the block is agricultural land both arable and pasture with some wooded areas.The main employment is agriculture and fishing on the river for salmon either netting or angling.
